ComicInfo.Summary:
Werewolf of Paris: Account of Francois Bertrand, French graveyard prowler.
The Dew Men: A legion of phantom soldiers marches over Crete, Greece.
Retribution: Two prospectors kill each other for gold.
A Shroud of Vengeance: The disfigured Abel Brendon is shunned by society, dies in a freak accident, is shocked back to life again by lightning and goes on a rampage against the townspeople. Trying to open the floodgates of the dam, he is struck by lightning again and dies a second time.
The Hole of Hell: Coal mine disaster in Wales. Two men go down and encounter the "black monster".
Death Tolls the Bells!: A wife killer is dragged before a "court" of demons and sentenced to hell.
The Get-Away: A dark stranger leads a murderer on the run into a shelter, down endless flights of stairs - straight into Hell.
Scream in the Night: The sadistic truck driver Joe Brixton likes to run down animals on the highway. One night he starts hallucinating about huge cat's eyes, runs off down the street and is hit by a truck.
The Accursed: Account of curses throughout history: Pharaohs, Indians, lost goldmines.
The Death Wish: Pilot Bruce Gordon crashes in the jungle, is rescued by natives, learns of hidden treasure, steals it by committing a murder. Back home he is haunted by vengeful spirits and meets his fate.
ComicInfo.Title: Werewolf of Paris; The Dew Men; Retribution; A Shroud of Vengeance; The Hole of Hell; Death Tolls the Bells!; The Get-Away; Scream in the Night; The Accursed; The Death Wish
